intro: Bartsia orerensis, commonly known as the Ethiopian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, yellowish flowers and linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in open, rocky areas and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Bartsia orerensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution.
